speaker.bio:
Hilary Stohs-Krause is a full-stack software developer at [Ten Forward Consulting](http://tenforward.consulting) in Madison, WI. She came to tech by way of childhood website-building (a _"Buffy the Vampire Slayer"_ fansite, to be exact). Before joining Ten Forward, she spent several years as a professional radio journalist in Lincoln, Nebraska, and attended Omaha Code School.

Hilary volunteers regularly with several tech and community organizations, and co-runs [Madison Women in Tech](http://madisonwomen.tech), a local group with more than 1,800 members. She loves board games, garlic-stuffed olives and bourbon barrel-aged stouts. She’ll read any fantasy or sci-fi she can get her hands on.

She tweets puns and intersectional feminism at [@hilarysk](http://twitter.com/hilarysk).
speaker.title: Using our powers for good: Tech and social impact
speaker.description:
Want to make a difference in your community, but don’t know how, or feel like you don’t have time?

You’re not alone. Luckily, there are a number of ways you can use your tech-industry skills to create positive change in your community - and yourself! (Fun fact: volunteers live longer and make more money than those who don’t volunteer.)

We’ll explore the why’s, how’s, and where’s for sharing our skills, both technical and non-technical. You’ll learn more about the breadth of ways to give back, and hopefully leave feeling empowered to reach out in your own community and start making connections.
